title: Armor of the Full Moons
contents: text | This fancy leather jerkin is made from a dark, slippery-looking hide of unknown provenance. It is etched with complex, overlapping circular patterns; in the moonlight of a High Confluence, these patterns glow with a very faint pale light. This light is barely bright enough to be seen, but not bright enough to provide illumination.
text | While wearing this armor, you have darkvision to 30 feet.
text | When attuned by a druid, the armor's AC bonus carries over to their Wildshape.

title: Mooji's Paramour
contents: text | This fancy leather jerkin is loose-fitting and, in its natural state, is made of an unremarkable weathered brown leather.

text | You can use a bonus action to speak the armor's command word and cause the armor to assume the appearance of a normal set of clothing or some other kind of armor. You decide what it looks like, including color, style, and accessories, but the armor retains its normal bulk and weight. The illusory appearance lasts until you use this property again or remove the armor.

title: Nightsinger
contents: text | This fancy leather jerkin is made of black leather and has prancing lions  embossed on the chest.  It is sized for a human.
text | You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in dim light or darkness.

title: Peacekeeper
contents: text | This double-bladed battle axe is made of a bright, silvery metal that always shines as if it were just polished.  It has a large head, and the handle is wrapped with soft black leather.
text | On a successful hit, you can choose to do additional radiant damage, a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per short rest.

title: Ragespike
contents: text | This shortsword has a slightly wavy blade, and has a lightning motif engraved into the blade.

text | You can use a bonus action to cause Ragespike to crackle with electricity until the end of your turn. While active, it inflicts additional lightning damage. This ability can be used a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus.

title: The Pyremaul
contents: text | Forged from deep red iron, this massive hammer houses an ever-burning gemstone of orange flame. The head of the hammer is always warm to the touch.
text | On a hit, the head becomes momentarily englufled in flames, and it does additional fire damage.

title: Weapon and Armor Bonuses
contents: description | Bonus | The attack and damage bonus (for weapons) or AC bonus (for armors) of legendary items evolves with its wielder's level.  At levels 1, the bonus is +0.  This increases at 5th level (+1), 11th level (+2), and 17th level (+3).

description | Additional Damage | Some weapons do additional damage under certain circumstances, as noted in the item's description.  At 1st level, this additional damage is 1d4.  This increases at 5th level (1d6), 11th level (1d8), and 17th level (1d10).  This damage may be a different type than that of the weapon.

title: Emerald
contents: text | While holding this gemstone, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the false life spell from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

text | The gemstone has 5 charges, and regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the gemstones's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the gemstone crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

title: Sapphire
contents: subtitle | Requires attunement by a caster
text | You can use an action to regain one expended spell slot. If the expended slot was of 4th level or higher, the new slot is 3rd level. You can use this feature once per day.

title: Ruby
contents: subtitle | Requires attunement by a druid

text | When you use your Wild Shape ability, the form's AC increases by your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) and the form's hit points and hit point maximum increase by your Wisdom modifier + your druid level.
text | The gemstone must be on your person when you transform and it becomes part of the chosen shape.

title: Amber
contents: text | While holding this gemstone, you can use an action to cast the protection from evil and good spell, up to a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.
text | When you reach 5th level, the recharge changes to short rest.

title: Peridot
contents: text | At the end of a short rest, choose one ability score.  Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. In addition, you gain proficiency in saving throws using the chosen ability.
text | The gemstone must be on your person to gain this effect, and you may change the ability score by reattuning to this gemstone after a short rest.

title: Diamond
contents: text | While holding this gemstone, you can use an action to cast either the blade ward or word of radiance spells.  Constitution is your spellcasting ability for them.

title: Jade
contents: text | As a reaction to taking damage, you can cast either the shield or absorb elements spell, up to a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.
text | When you reach 5th level, the recharge changes to short rest.

title: Topaz
contents: subtitle | Req. attunement by a spellcaster
text | You have advantage on concentration checks.

title: Opal
contents: text | You stabilize whenever you are dying at the start of your turn. In addition, whenever you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, double the number of hit points it restores. This effect persists even if you lose consciousness or are incapacitated.
